CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 14, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "Aquamaid! - Shapely Miss Marilyn Ware shows what the well-dressed lass will wear on the beach. She was one of the models in fashion revue at May-Stern auditorium, Monday evening.  This show was sponsored for the benefit of a scholarship fund which as been established by the Toujours Fideles Club to aid some worthy youth seeking a college education.  A large crowd packed both the auditorium and the lobby to see the glamorous models on parade.  This show will become an annual event. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Marilyn Ware Parker modeling two piece satin bathing suit, in front of painted stone wall, for benefit fashion show in May - Stern furniture store auditorium
